Job Title: Business Development Associate

Location: Greater Chicago Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Full Circle Electronics (FCE) is on the lookout for a dynamic and highly motivated remote Business Development Associate to enhance our team. This role is ideal for a proactive self-starter eager to drive the company's expansion by identifying and seizing new sales opportunities, particularly within data-sensitive sectors such as Financial Services and Healthcare. Under the guidance of the VP of Sales, the ideal candidate will excel in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating exceptional multitasking skills and the ability to deliver precise and punctual work consistently. Additionally, the ideal candidate will either have experience in or a passion for sustainability and environmental initiatives, aligning with FCE's commitment to eco-friendly business practices.
DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive the generation of high-quality leads through targeted outbound calling and email outreach, utilizing tools like Zoominfo, and adhere to proven sales methodologies.Qualify prospects based on their potential and schedule meetings for the VP of Sales, aiming to achieve and surpass agreed-upon sales targets and outcomes.Conduct both in-person and virtual meetings with existing and prospective clients to understand their needs and present our solutions, directly contributing to the sales pipeline and customer relationship management.Coordinate sales efforts seamlessly with team members and the VP of Sales, fostering a collaborative work environment.Conduct in-depth industry research in collaboration with the VP of Sales to identify companies of interest, focusing on market trends, competitor positions, and potential regulatory impacts.Regularly maintain and update CRM activities in Salesforce, ensuring data accuracy and actionable insights.Execute direct email marketing campaigns to key clients and prospects, integrating sustainability messages where appropriate.Conduct client or market surveys to gather information about potential leads, emphasizing feedback on environmental concerns or preferences.Participate in the preparation of proposals and/or sales presentations, highlighting the environmental and sustainability advantages of our products and services.Provide accurate and timely reports to management on sales activities and forecasted pipelines.Develop a robust understanding of the company’s products and services, with a special focus on their environmental benefits and sustainability features, to better facilitate the sales process.
SKILLS + EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Essential Experience: 1-2 years in lead generation or sales-related roles preferred; candidates with substantial internship experience in sales or marketing also encouraged to apply.Communication Mastery: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills are a must.Salesforce Proficiency: Strong experience with CRM systems required, Salesforce expertise strongly preferred.Analytical Skills: Experience in research, maintaining databases, and using MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).Cold Calling Expertise: Proven ability in cold outreach and engagement.Organizational Skills: Demonstrated project and time management abilities; capable of thriving in a fast-paced and fluid environment.Team Collaboration: A collaborative communicator with a positive, creative problem-solving attitude and a "can-do" approach.Environmental Passion: An interest or background in Environmental studies is a plus, reflecting our commitment to sustainable business practices.Relationship Building: A natural at building productive professional relationships.Sales Excellence: Highly motivated and target-driven, with a documented history of sales success.Adaptability: Skilled at navigating change and solving practical problems in dynamic situations.Mobility and Travel Readiness: Ability to travel to meet with current and prospective customers as required. 
 EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSBachelor’s Degree in Environmental Studies, Sustainability, or a related field is preferred

Experience Level (if available): Associate
